alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron and Willacy. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Harlingen, San Benito, Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Rio Hondo High School, Rio Hondo Elementary School, Rio Hondo Junior High School, Rio Hondo City Hall, Lozano, San Benito Veterans Memorial Academy, Downs Elementary School, Miller Jordan Middle School, San Benito Police Department, San Benito Library, San Benito City Hall, Landrum Park, San Benito High School, South Texas Academy Of Medical Technology, San Benito Fire Department Station One and Monte Grande. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
